page.title: 11Llanrwst
page.content: The housing in Llanrwst, although mainly old, is of a more urban nature. Many of the oldest buildings, some of which had fallen into disuse and disrepair have recently been restored as dwellings. A group of very old, dilapidated cottages have been turned into single person accommodation, warden controlled, and other homes built nearby make a compact group. The old brewery has been adapted into 5 apartments, and in the same street the old Tannery has been altered to make a workshop and 2 flats. There is an estate of council houses and many privately owned homes. Trefriw has a small council estate situated at the top of a very steep hill and includes houses for old people. Houses in great variety are scattered between the two main centres of population.
